headline: 'The Five' on FBI's response to DOJ whistleblower

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS MCMICHAEL, AHMAUD ARBERY SHOOTER
utterances.sentences: Let's see what happens and make sure everybody is OK. Instead, identify.

utterances.speaker: LINDA DUNIKOSKI, PROSECUTOR
utterances.sentences: All right. So, you just said, based on everything you think something had happened.

utterances.speaker: MCMICHAEL
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: DUNIKOSKI
utterances.sentences: But you had no idea what happened.

utterances.speaker: MCMICHAEL
utterances.sentences: At that time, I didn't.

utterances.speaker: DUNIKOSKI
utterances.sentences: All right. And --

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hi, I'm Greg Gutfeld, along with Katie Pavlich, Geraldo Rivera, Jesse Watters, and she snowboard in a bowl of sugar. Dana Perino. THE FIVE. President Biden's FBI using a tool normally meant for ISIS and Al Qaeda to target parents. A whistleblower claims the bureau's criminal and counterterrorism divisions created a threat tag to log incidents of school board officials allegedly facing threats of violence. Republicans are demanding answers.

utterances.speaker: REP. JIM JORDAN (R-OH)
utterances.sentences: At this moment, the FBI is not maybe, is treating parents as terrorist threats. And the attorney general came in front of the committee and said just the opposite.

utterances.speaker: REP. GREG MURPHY (R-NC)
utterances.sentences: Attorney General Garland basically purged himself in front of Congress and should really face the consequences before this.

utterances.speaker: SEN. JOSH HAWLEY (R-MO)
utterances.sentences: What this shows us, in fact, the parents are getting domestic terrorist treatment. Garland said, no, we would not treat them like domestic terrorist, the very least we are going to need put them under oath and bring them before the committee and say what the world is going on?

utterances.speaker: MERRICK GARLAND, UNITED STATES ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterances.sentences: I can't imagine any circumstance in which the Patriot Act would be used in the circumstances of parents complaining about their children nor can I imagine the circumstances where they would be labeled as domestic terrorism.

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well done.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: I read that call this morning and I got to that far and I was like wait, what?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So, they made it worse by comparing them to actual criminals by claiming that they weren't doing it. And they also confirmed that the memo from the whistleblower is real as well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So, they confirm that. Obviously, they are trying to squash dissent here. Let's remember how this started. The National School Board Association sent a letter to the White House, it's working with the White House staff saying we have this problem with the parents, we want the Justice Department and FBI to go after them. They toss it over to DOJ and the DOJ, you know, creates this task force and then it becomes public and the National School Board Association withdraws the letter. But the FBI continues with the task force. So, Merrick Garland goes on Capitol Hill and claims this isn't happening. The fact that they haven't withdrawn the task force proves that this is all about quashing dissent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Because the left has had a lock on education for decades. The parents now are a threat to that power. And they are using the FBI, this administration, to take care of what they perceive as a problem. And if you don't think the teachers unions and these leftist organizations like the National School Board Association have control and power go back to when the CDC was writing school guidance for masking and COVID regulations, right? So, don't -- that clip they don't have the kind of influence with the Justice department as well to go after parents who are showing up at the school board meetings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana, is this like, Merrick Garland, is he lying or is this some kind of cluelessness that allows for plausible deniability because you see this a lot with this administration. Especially with, you know, Joe Biden where he would say he didn't know something and then you find out he does. Is it just not, are they deliberately not knowing things? Because I do that sometimes to get out of trouble.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's a good way to stay out of trouble, --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- isn't it? That can definitely can happen in Washington where like, well, I wasn't in a meeting --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- so I don't know. I take notes, I don't know. In some -- when I first got the FBI statement this morning so it comes out during America's Newsroom, so I get it and I read it, call them. And I read them like, OK, that makes sense, I got it wait, I got it tag. And then I was like, wait, what? You just said that they're human drug traffickers? As a communications person I can imagine that the boss comes in and says, hey, this is what we are going to say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And you read that and say, great, send. You don't say, wait, we can't say that unless we are actually doing it. When the Patriot Act was reauthorized, well, initially passed and then reauthorized, there was all these concerned that it would be used against American citizens. And there were all these safeguards that was supposed to be put in place. And everyone said we don't do that. That doesn't never happen but we would never do that, but now, citizens could be definitely forgiven for thinking that it does. And this is what I would say to the FBI and also to Merrick Garland, especially when the school board association withdraw the letter, there is no shame in backing what.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right? Maybe it's a new cycles worth of, you guys are so such idiots. Fine. But that's better than drug in this through and making people further distrust the FBI. That's like really not something we need right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know, it does, Geraldo, I do now like, wonder if I was wrong supporting the Patriot Act when people were saying this because I was like, always thinking now this wouldn't happen. This -- there has been a lot of blunders, but this might be the biggest deal breaker for independence because they're open. Everybody is a parent except for me. You are a parent.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You've been a parent many times.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Many times, over.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And as more thing will indicate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: One more thing, one more time.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I worry that about hyperventilating in Congress. The Senate I was really dismayed, I'm sorry, by the tone that they were so, so disrespectful when they have the attorney general there for the first time. These congressmen Jim Jordan from my home state. I mean, they know that this is not using the Patriot Act to snoop on. I let --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But they just said it --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Let me finish.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They're not characterizing parents as domestic terrorists. It is the statistical tool. There was a trend of violent confrontations in these school board meetings. I understand why --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They don't have any evidence.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I don't like the teachers union. I understand however how they could be alarmed, let's say, by the passion. And a lot of it mirrors what's happening right, left, Trump, Biden, you know, it is distressing in this country. And it is -- I understand the suspicion that people have of the other side. I am dismayed by it, but I --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Let's stay -- I'll take Geraldo at his word but that still doesn't warrant you to use this enforcement arm to scare the crap or intimidate parents.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Threat tags like when the FBI opens a file on someone.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They open files but they haven't opened up a formal investigation. So, they are looking at narcotics trafficker, they are looking at someone that's running women for the mafia. They are looking for an Islamic terrorist or a militia man. But here's the thing. The memo says the task force involves the counterterrorism division.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And the national security division of the FBI. The Patriot Act is the primary tool used by those divisions that allows for easy wiretapping snooping on computers, phones.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: On foreign nationals.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Inserting -- well, people in this country. And you can insert informants into those things, you can do all kinds of things, right? And so that's why this is so dangerous. And they've already had a meeting about it according to the memo, this task force. And so, we need to bring these people back into Congress and say what happened at this damn meeting? Because this is a huge escalation. Remember, Geraldo, they keep -- FBI keeps files on a lot of people. They kept it on Martin Luther King, Marilyn Monroe, Helen Keller. And they keep it on a lot of people and is not a good thing, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Can I ask you, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's a threat matrix against the U.S. citizens where you can share information from local, state, and federal law enforcement.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Do you concede --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's not good.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Do you concede that there is an alarming increase, apparently in these --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Apparently.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- very vigorous --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You condition your --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- passion --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You condition your own equation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There was one local beef that was charged. There was one -- two low local beefs that was charged.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Even if there --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: One was a violent threat and then the other guy got arrested and that was because they've covered up with daughter's --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But also, I mean, you guys have kids. If there is an organization that's getting between you and your kids, you are going to get pissed off. That's different than being a threat and they are treating you like ISIS in cardigan sweaters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is nuts.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You can't treat parents like narcotics --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'll give you -- I'll give you a hypothetical. I'm a parent. Your teaching pedophilia is good for you in school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK. I wouldn't, let's be clear. What the hell of a hypothetical.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So, I say, listen, this is inappropriate and I want to kill you for doing this and I'm going to burn the school down because people like you're exactly why I hate --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Can I give you a non-hypothetical?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, do the non-hypothetical.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Like a non-hypothetical is that the attorney general admitted they have no evidence there in their own investigation and that the only thing they went off it was this National School Board Association letter saying, apparently, there were incidents, that's what they went off and that letter has been withdrawn. So, they have nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. All right, speaking of nothing, we got something.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's a transition. Up next, big developments in the Kyle Rittenhouse trial as we get closer to a verdict. Yes.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, HOST, CNN
utterances.sentences: I don't see how anybody can say that this judge is not biased and is not leaning in a certain direction.

utterances.speaker: BAKARI SELLERS, POLITICAL COMMENTATOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: He is shielding Kyle Rittenhouse treating him as if he is a child.

utterances.speaker: SUNNY HOSTIN, CO-HOST, ABC
utterances.sentences: This judge throughout what many people believe would be the one charge that he would be convicted of.

utterances.speaker: JOY REID, HOST, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: His phone was going off with like the song that gets played at Trump rallies. But we won't go into that too deeply.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, HOST, CNN
utterances.sentences: What about the judge involving Rittenhouse and drawing those numbers? I've never seen that.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Never.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Granted. So, it doesn't happen?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Never. I've never ever, ever seen that before.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE SCHROEDER, JUDGE, KENOSHA COUNTY CIRCUIT COURT, WISCONSIN
utterances.sentences: When I talk about problems with the media when this trial started, that's -- we were there in part. Not fully, but in part because of grossly irresponsible handling of what still comes out of this trial. I will tell you this, and I'm going to think long and hard about live television of the trial again next time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because the media would say something -- and it's funny. People are watching it and there is still a segment of media boldly lying about what's happening, Sellers especially, is just full of falsehood. I think we are at a stage where every juror that takes part in a trial will have to be placed in witness relocation after the trial because the media in a fraud (Ph) and activist class puts them in danger because they see violence as an appropriate response if the jury doesn't come back with the decision that they want. So, the media perpetuates the cycle. Right? If there is riot, they will call them mostly peaceful which then puts the cops on notice, right, that you better not arm these peaceful protesters holding their Molotov cocktails. And they will deliberately like those clowns ignore the facts of the case, bear the truth about Jacob Blake, the truth about the man that Rittenhouse or the non-men that Rittenhouse killed in order to make sure that there is, there is trouble later. I'm not rooting for anything but justice. So, I will live with whatever outcome there is. But the media plays as a lower bar for the activist class. They believe that their behavior can include any kind of violence no matter what. I said this, and I said this yesterday to the audible gasps a month ago when I talked about the Chauvin verdict that I was relieved that Chauvin was found guilty because my neighborhood would not be torched. There was a commentary on this and how the justice system is now being held hostage by threats of mayhem because the media will allow the activist to riot for that reason.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: You know, Dana, the judge has received a number of threats as a result of this trial.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, that might just be a little bit a sign of the times. In our first block we were talking about passions but then also sound like threats and then the FBI is involved. And then the judge. I understand why they don't want cameras in the courtroom because in some ways that this is just a distraction and it could put the jury in jeopardy or make them perhaps change their minds. But I also think that the trial being on television helped a lot of people understand what was actually happening that night. Why did Kyle Rittenhouse feel threatened? Was it self-defense? If you had, well, and you just think, what if it wasn't on television where the prosecution's witness admits that he had a gun pointed at Kyle Rittenhouse.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That -- so without that, we wouldn't have known. And I think that -- so I think that's good. I'm very interested in this whole process of there is a mistrial motion and when the judge can make a decision and that also includes even if they find him guilty. They could -- he could go back and say mistrial and prosecution has to start all over. We don't know what's going to happen --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- but we'll watch that very closely.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So, Geraldo, can you comment on that with your legal expertise on why the mistrial motion was filed? Again, there was one filed previously in the trial because the prosecution withheld evidence of high-quality video. So, the jury had seen the video before but it was low-quality and you're supposed to submit the most high-quality version of the evidence.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think what the defense is indicating is that they would have proceeded in a different way --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- if they had that vivid, high-quality video and knew more precisely what their client did. I think that a couple of things. I think that on the basis of the defense moving for mistrial without prejudice, which means the state would have a do-over, that doesn't seem that they have a lot of confidence in their case for the defense to do that. Why would they want a mistrial without prejudice, a do-over if they thought they were winning right now? So, you know, I'm starting to feel a little bad on the fact that the deliberations are now being prolonged. But remember when I was starting in the news business decades ago, there was a guy and the Warner Wolf was the sports guy who said "let's go to the videotape." Nowadays, because of body cams on cops and surveillance cameras everywhere and drones with cameras, people, the jurors are discounting the physical testimony and are asking to be their own witnesses by looking at the videotape themselves and making a determination what they see. Did Rittenhouse provoked, you know, the first victim Rosenbaum or was he merely trying to defend himself?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So, if you see in the videotape, if, indeed Rittenhouse is pointing the gun first and then the whole thing happens, it's different than if Rosenbaum in his face do crazy --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, Jesse, there's the issue too, is that the prosecution got berated by the judge multiple times during the trial for trying to introduce evidence that are already been thrown out and now we are learning that they didn't actually give the defense the proper evidence.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I am so shocked at how unethical lawyers can be. These guys, you know was not --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: First --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- doctoring evidence against Donald Trump. They are embezzling money and shaking down people like Avenatti. And remember those with Mueller, just destroyed their iPhones after that witch hunt. It's just -- I love these people who are supposed to be independent actors. They are just like the rest of us. They're just a bunch of really dirty rotten scoundrels. These are rogue prosecutors. They are rogue runaway prosecutors. And this is great because now we can see how dastardly they are. And if you didn't have cameras, you get the press come out and lie about what would happen in the court room.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's like right now if they didn't have a window here, the press would say it's raining. And then they open up the window, no rain. The press still tells me it's raining. That's why the country doesn't trust the press anymore. Because we can see. We have the internet now. We have full visibility cameras in the courtroom. You can see the actual documents. The FBI I.G. reports. You see it's a great, great time to be alive in this country. And we are just being lied to in our faces. And it's sick the way the press is also trashing this judge. They don't like this judge because he supposed to be impartial. The left hates impartiality. They want activist in roads that's why every person they appoint to the high court is a total left-winger. The liberal justice has ever cross over to side with the conservatives. It's always the conservative justice is crossing over because they have some semblance of independence. No, no, no, they don't like this guy even though this judge appointed by a Democrat --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- and ran for election like a bunch of times. The people put him there.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And there was an Associated Press headline today that was frustrating with the deference the judge had to the defendant but let's remember you are innocent until proven guilty in America. All right. Coming up, wokeness gone way too far? The shocking story of a college professor trying to normalize pedophilia.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ALLYN WALKER, ASSISTANT PROFESSOR, DOMINION UNIVERSITY
utterances.sentences: I used the term minor attracted person or MAT in the title and throughout the book for multiple reasons. First of all, because I think it's important to use terminology for groups that members of that group want others to use for them. And MAT advocacy groups like before you act have advocated for use of the term MAT. They have advocated for it primarily because it's less stigmatizing than other terms like pedophile. A lot of people when they hear the term pedophile, they automatically assume that it means a sex offender. And that isn't true and it leads to a lot of misconceptions about attractions towards minors.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly. You have a little more, do you want to --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I have more? I just want to say --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I appreciate you wanted to have a conversation.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- I wanted your answer. OK. The professor later saying I want to be clear child sexual abuse is an excusable crime.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: OK, now we're ready.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Now we're ready.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And we're back.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And we're back. Well, I drew the line at chest feeders and birthing people and memes for women.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: How about Nazis and rapists?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And this person goes by the pronouns they, them and is transgendered. People who warned about this language manipulation and rejection of reality leading to something like this, redefining the terms of child sex abuse and pedophilia were called bigots and intolerant. So, I'm glad that we have a line for this kind of language manipulation but these are the same people who have been saying that you should allow people like this professor of sociology and criminal justice to put drag queens in your kindergartner's schools for story hour. So, if you are a parent and you are saying, "no, thank you" like my underage kid is not going to be subjected to this rejection of reality. You are not a bigot. You are perfectly within your rights of thinking that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm actually flashing back to grade school in the city. I think the word drag queens entertaining the children. But listen to this. Minor attracted person. So, you knew -- you know who not to hire for your babysitter. The minor attracted person.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The MAT.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know, Geraldo. I see this as like, I want to support full academic scholarship you should be able to pursue as far as you want, any taboo or controversial issue. But this is not a legitimate academic pursuit. This is trying to have a Ph.D. help with the branding for the pedophile community. That's what this is about and it's taxpayer money/ This is funded by the taxpayers at old dominion, public school. This kind of is like the illegal immigration thing, oh you can't call me illegal immigrants --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Oh, come on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- because illegal --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Stigmatizing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- is stigmatizing them and we don't want to do that, so we're just going to call them wanderers or something like that. You have stigmas for a reason, Geraldo, OK. Pedophilia has a bad stigma because it's one of the nastiest things you can do. Now, here's what she says. She says that just because you are attracted to a minor, doesn't mean those people act on that attraction. OK. Show me someone who's attracted to a child --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: She was the key? That person was the key?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Show me someone that's attracted to a young child as an adult that hasn't tried to touch that person, who hasn't surveilled a playground, who hasn't put themselves in an environment where other children are around, or maybe even watched it on the internet. No. That attraction is the strongest attraction in the human body. It's hormonal it's inside your body. It's chemical inside your body. There's nothing you can do about that. You have to keep those people away from children and stop trying to soft-pedal it like it's just some attraction no one pursues.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But is this, Dana, you know so stupid that it will affect -- is it -- isn't wokeness in retreat? Isn't this like the last gasp? This is so ridiculous. It's such a stupid idea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I guess -- I mean, they keep giving us examples to bring up. I mean, they're not stopping. I do think that the American people are saying like, we are sick of it. But I see his point that -- her point, sorry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They or them.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They say they or them?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Their point --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Did I misgender her or him?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think so. But I do too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You need to be fired for that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I apologize.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Go to H.R. right now.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I apologize.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: With the point being that perhaps somebody is attracted to children but they haven't acted on it. But I do think that there's this miss -- this has missed a point all day long which is the outrageousness of child pornography and the pervasiveness of that all around the world on the internet is so disgusting and it's happening all across the world. And if you think about one of the things that the Justice Department recently did, they've had that big takedown of that child pornography syndicate. I mean, there is harm that can be done to children even if they're not touched by the person who has that attraction. That is a huge issue.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The Justice Department just did that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Recently, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well done. Garland, stick to that stuff. Stick to that, Garland.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
